sourceMeaningMnemonic: <radical>Part</radical> <radical>rain</radical>, part other stuff. I imagine this is what people thought the <kanji>atmosphere</kanji> was made out of thousands of years ago.
meaningInfo: Imagine looking up into the sky, trying to figure out what the atmosphere up there is made out of. Your only lead: It's raining, a lot. So, the atmosphere must be partly made of rain, and it's just falling down.
readingMnemonic: The reading for this kanji is actually the same as <ja>分</ja>s. One trick about complicated kanji is they often take the reading of one of the pieces that they're made from. In this case it's <ja>分</ja>, which is cool.
readingInfo: Also, studying the <kanji>atmosphere</kanji> is a ton of <reading>fun</reading> (<ja>ふん</ja>), if you're into that sort of thing.
